title: heavy rounded 50s script needed
content:
Working on a film set in mid 50s, much of the typography on signage and logos was hand drawn, and in some cases we'll be doing that. But many times I find font designers are using those handwritten signs as inspiration for recent fonts that I could revise for a hand drawn look. Some I've found on myfonts, but what I am having trouble finding is the very thick curvy script fonts; so hard to create, I know, but there must be some out there. Any suggestions? Thanks. I'll attach an example.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [DB logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110515104228/http:/typophile.com/files/DB%20logo.jpg) | 6.3 KB |
author: kayle

comments.content: Have a look at the offerings of [Sudtipos](http://web.archive.org/web/20110515104228/http:/www.sudtipos.com/home), [House Industries](http://web.archive.org/web/20110515104228/http:/www.houseind.com/) and [Letterhead Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20110515104228/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/).
